Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

<<> AzureBlade: I do not recall that North America is Predacon Territory, 
> and it isn't Maximal territory either. Neutral Terrain remains such. 
> If you were mentionning my earlier venture near your base, then I 
> would have to say that I am a Maximal, and that I consider helping my 
> brethrens as my duty. And bravery, my esteemed Kali, is not difficult 
> to find. Would you dare to stand up to your leaders because of what 
> you think?>>

North America...so then that was their location. Neutral Terrain to boot. 
That meant Kali wouldn't dare to try an attack out here...would she? Or would 
she defy her leaders? In any case, despite her beast form being partially 
bat, Mistra would be glad to be free of this cave...and of any possible 
conflict at the current time. When she changed...or maybe not...her 
activation code, things would be different of course.

> 
> <<He looked at her intensely. She read open defiance, and he knew it. He 
> just wished she could let them go. Besides, Prowl had told him about 
> the non-agression pact. That could be the key.
> 
> AzureBlade: As for my friend Mistra, I believe she has already chosen. 
> I will also refresh your memory, if you allow. Maximals and Predacons 
> have agreed to non agression, right? If you do not let us go safely, 
> this could mean war. Think, and you shall see you clearly do not want 
> a war. Now step aside.>>

Mistra was confused...but things were looking up. So...the Maximals and 
Predacons had agreed to non-agression then. She just hoped Kali would listen 
to Azure's words and move to aside for them to leave. Oddly enough...Kali 
hadn't seemed to do more than glance at her before her full attention was on 
Azure. Perhaps because he looked more daunting to the Predacon as he was than 
she did. It made sense, come to think of it...or perhaps because she was as 
of yet, still new to this planet and its conflicts. Or just the fact she'd 
already chosen her side, and Kali didn't see any point in trying to change 
her mind. Whatever the reason, Mistra was glad Azure had taken charge in this 
situation.


--part1_41.1822c544.2996e7dd_boundary
